alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Cotton; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Comanche, Cotton and southeastern Tillman Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cache to 3 miles south of Chattanooga to 4 miles south of Grandfield. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Walters, Cache, Geronimo, Grandfield, Temple, Chattanooga, Randlett, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Devol, Faxon, Loveland, Cookietown, Fort Sill, Hulen, Taylor, southern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge, and The Visitor Center. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 5 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
